title: Module 3 Quiz: Isaac Sim, Isaac ROS, VSLAM, and Navigation for Humanoids

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of Isaac Sim in robotics development?
options: High-fidelity physics simulation and photorealistic rendering for robotics

questions.text: Which physics engine does Isaac Sim primarily use for simulation?
What does VSLAM stand for in the context of robotics?
options: Vision-based System for Localization and Mapping

questions.text: In Isaac ROS, which sensor processing acceleration is specifically designed for stereo vision?
What is the main advantage of using synthetic data generation in Isaac Sim?
options: Perfectly labeled training data for AI models
Direct transfer to real-world applications without domain adaptation

questions.text: Which coordinate system does Isaac Sim use by default?
What is the Zero Moment Point (ZMP) in humanoid robotics?
options: The point where the robot's center of mass is located
The point where the sum of all moments caused by gravity and inertia forces equals zero
The point where the robot's feet touch the ground
The point where the robot's vision system is focused

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a key feature of Isaac ROS?
In Nav2 for humanoids, what is the primary challenge that differentiates it from wheeled robot navigation?
options: The need to maintain dynamic balance during locomotion

questions.text: What is the main purpose of the Behavior Tree in Nav2?
options: To define the decision-making logic for navigation
